comments:
build I20041013

I was trying to run a simple RCP app.  In the launch config, I did the usual:
- select the application
- in the plugins tab, deselect all, select the app's plug-ins, and add prequisites
- I did not include org.eclipse.update.configurator
- on the Configuration tab, I left it as the default: Generate a config.ini with
default content
- launch

It launches OK, but in the log I get:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Oct 14, 2004 15:58:32.297
!MESSAGE Error installing bundle:
reference:file:D:/eclipse-I20041013/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.0/
!STACK 0
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Bundle "org.eclipse.osgi" version "3.1.0"
has already been installed from: System Bundle
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorkerPrivileged(Framework.java:751)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework$2.run(Framework.java:664)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged1(Native Method)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(AccessController.java:351)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorker(Framework.java:715)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installBundle(Framework.java:659)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.installBundle(BundleContextImpl.java:219)
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.installBundles(EclipseStarter.java:800)
	at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.loadBasicBundles(EclipseStarter.java:429)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.startup(EclipseStarter.java:222)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:127)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:85)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:185)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:684)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:668)


The generated config.ini for this launch config has:
#Eclipse Runtime Configuration File
#Thu Oct 14 16:33:17 EDT 2004
osgi.bundles=reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/demo.fileexplorer.editors.txt/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/demo.fileexplorer.workbench/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/demo.fileexplorer.editors.html/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/demo.fileexplorer.editors.win32/,reference\:file\:D\:/eclipse-I20041013/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.expressions_3.1.0/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime/@2\:start,reference\:file\:D\:/eclipse-I20041013/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.help_3.0.0/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.jface/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.jface.text/,reference\:file\:D\:/eclipse-I20041013/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.0/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.platform/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.swt/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.win32/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.text/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.ui/,reference\:file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.ui.workbench/
osgi.bundles.defaultStartLevel=4
osgi.install.area=file\:d\:\\eclipse-I20041013\\eclipse
osgi.framework=file\:D\:/eclipse-I20041013/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.0/
osgi.configuration.cascaded=false
osgi.splashPath=file\:d\:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.platform/

The problem seems to be that osgi.bundles lists the org.eclipse.osgi bundle
explicitly, even though it's also listed in osgi.framework.

In my defense, I was on medication that causes drowsiness when I introduced 
this regression.

Fixed.

traces.message: Bundle "org.eclipse.osgi" version "3.1.0" has already been installed from: System Bundle
